item.name: Build Hello World
item.description: Learn how to build a simple Java application in JDeveloper.

item.name: Build a Fusion Web Application
item.description: Learn how to build a web application using ADF Faces, ADF Task Flows, ADF Model and ADF Business Components.

item.name: Build a Java Swing Application with Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to build a Java application using ADF Swing, ADF Model and ADF Business Components.

item.name: Build a Web Application with EJB, JPA and JSF
item.description: Learn how to build a web application using JSF, EJB 3.0 and JPA.

item.name: Build a Java Swing Application
item.description: Create a Java application and build the user interface (UI) using Swing components.

item.name: Build a Mobile Browser Application with Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to create a mobile web browser user interface designed for an ADF application.

item.name: Fusion Developer's Guide for Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to create and deploy web-based applications using Oracle ADF Business Components, Oracle ADF task flows, and Oracle ADF Faces.

item.name: Web User Interface Developer's Guide for Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to create web-based applications using Oracle ADF Faces Rich Client components and supporting architecture.

item.name: Java EE Developer's Guide for Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to create web-based applications using Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB), Oracle ADF Model, Oracle ADF Controller, and Oracle ADF Faces Rich Client.

item.name: Desktop Integration Developer's Guide for Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to extend the functionality provided by a Fusion web application to desktop applications.

item.name: Mobile Browser Developer's Guide for Oracle ADF
item.description: Learn how to develop enterprise mobile applications for PDA browsers, using Oracle ADF Mobile browser.

item.name: Create and Use a JSF Declarative Component
item.description: Create a JSF declarative component in a project and deploy the project to an ADF Library JAR, then consume the declarative component in JSF pages.

item.name: Implement Drag and Drop
item.description: Define component attributes to use as drag sources and as targets for accepting drops, then create and register custom drop event handling code on target components.

item.name: Use Layout Components
item.description: Create a page layout by nesting Panel Stretch Layout, Panel Splitter, and other layout components to define specific areas on a page for headers, footers, and body contents.

item.name: Create ADF Menus for Page Navigation
item.description: Create tabs and lists by defining unbounded task flows and ADF menu model metadata for a menu hierarchy, and then binding navigation pane and bread crumbs components to the menu model.

item.name: Implement a Multi-Step Page Flow with ADF Train
item.description: Use the ADF Faces Train component on a set of pages to display a series of navigation items that guide users through a multi-step task.

item.name: Customize and Personalize an Application
item.description: Learn how to customize and personalize an application that is built with Oracle ADF Faces and Oracle ADF Business Components.

item.name: Use a Bean Data Control
item.description: Learn how to create a simple databound application using JavaBeans and ADF Faces.

item.name: Use a URL Service Data Control
item.description: Learn how to create a URL data control from an XML schema that defines the structure of an RSS feed.

item.name: Use a Placeholder Data Control
item.description: Learn how to use placeholder data controls with ADF databinding to build complete, runnable pages.

item.name: Enable Security in a Fusion Web Application
item.description: Learn how to build a Fusion web application and enable ADF security in it.

item.name: Developer's Guide for Oracle WebCenter
item.description: Learn how to use WebCenter Composer components to build an Oracle WebCenter Framework application.

item.name: Create and Register Portlets with Oracle WebCenter Suite
item.description: Create and register an Oracle PDK-Java portlet and a standards-based Java portlet, and then add the portlets to a JSF page.

item.name: Add Content to a JSF Page
item.description: Create a WebCenter application, and then create a content repository data control that exposes content from a content repository.

item.name: Portletize a JSF Application Using JSF Portlet Bridge
item.description: Create a JSF application, create and portletize a task flow, and then consume the resulting portlet from a WebCenter application.

item.name: Build a JSF Page that is Editable at Runtime
item.description: Create a WebCenter application and a JSF page and then add WebCenter Composer components to the page to make the page editable at runtime.

item.name: Build a Simple JSF Application
item.description: Create a JSPX document, design the UI with JSF components, and modify the behavior through code.

item.name: Create JSF Page Navigation
item.description: Create a JSF navigation diagram to design the navigation, create JSF pages from the diagram and add the UI, then modify the behavior through code.

item.name: Bind a JSF Page to a Managed Bean
item.description: Create a JSF page and a Java class, then register the class as a managed bean, and bind the UI in the page to the managed bean.

item.name: Create a Simple EJB Session Bean
item.description: Create a session bean, add a business method, then create a sample Java client and run it.

item.name: Build a JPA Application
item.description: Create entities from tables, create fields for the entity, generate a Java service facade, and then run it.

item.name: Consume a Web Service from a Web Page
item.description: Create a data control from a web service, test the web service, and run a page that consumes the data control.

item.name: Create a Web Service from a Java Class
item.description: Use the bottom-up approach to create a web service from a Java class.

item.name: Create a Java Web Service from a WSDL
item.description: Use the top-down approach to create a Java web service from a WSDL.

item.name: Developer's Guide for Oracle SOA Suite
item.description: Learn how to build an SOA composite application with the components that comprise Oracle SOA Suite.

item.name: Design an SOA Composite Application
item.description: Learn how to design a SOA composite application, create an application deployment profile for it, and deploy it.

item.name: Design an SOA Composite for Oracle B2B
item.description: Add a B2B binding component to a SOA composite application by accessing the binding component and selecting the document definition for the service.

item.name: Create an ADF Page With Oracle BAM Data Control
item.description: Learn how to create an ADF page using an Oracle BAM data control to display real-time data in your application.
